quoteLast: , Felicity had not missed her. She was soon--with a mind relieved at least from that portion of its load--giving a report, with excisions something like those practised on Russian newspapers, of her morning’s employment, and adorning it with touches, so nicely adapted to Felicity’s humour, that the latter ended by expressing an ecstatic wonder as to how she had ever managed to bear so long the absence from her side of such a seasoner and sweetener of her own toilsome existence.
title: A waif's progress
author: Broughton, Rhoda, 1840-1920

quoteFirst: It's the same old thing in the army; you say to yourself it can't be done; but it is done. And at
quoteLast: the whole brigade was moving out of Corbie, and was once more facing towards the Somme.
title: On the right of the British line
author: Nobbs, Gilbert

quoteFirst: Still the Slasher did not appear; and two o’clock having arrived, Spring said he would only give five minutes more, and should then consider Freeman was entitled to the money if the Slasher did not arrive. Within the time specified Slasher was brought slowly to the field of battle, having, according to Broome’s account, taken from seven minutes to one to
quoteLast: to come very little more than two miles. Cheerfulness succeeded wrangling, and all looked well for the gratification of the throng, who had come far and near to witness the battle.
title:
Pugilistica: The History of British Boxing, Volume 3 (of 3)

author: Miles, Henry Downes, 1806-1889

quoteFirst: WITNESS: 'Avin made a mistake once, by saying
quoteLast: to the policeman as called hisself a insurance agent, which 'e put the words into my mouth, I ain't a goin' to do so again, it bein' five minutes afore two, as I can swear to.
title: The Mystery of a Hansom Cab
author: Hume, Fergus, 1859-1932

quoteFirst: Two loving, two happy mortals, earnest, devoted, passionate, devoutly happy; while in society the thing will be announced indifferently and drily, somewhat in this fashion: ‘Have you heard? Martha Dotzky is engaged to Tilling--a poor match!’ It is
quoteLast: . He may come now any minute.
